Text: ”Come, bless the LORD, all you servants of the LORD who serve by night in the house of the LORD.“
Context: A call for the Levitical priests who work at night to bless the LORD. This verse opens the psalm with a summons to worship, framing the context of the priesthood and their ministering in the temple.

Text: ”Lift up your hands to the sanctuary and bless the LORD.“
Context: The gesture of lifting hands is a form of worship and blessing to God. Indicates a physical act of praise and blessing to God, commonly practiced in liturgical settings.

Text: ”May the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth, bless you from Zion.“
Context: An inversion of the call to bless the LORD; now the LORD is asked to bless the servants. Suggests the idea of reciprocal blessing between the LORD and His servants, highlighting God’s sovereignty as the Creator.
